Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse, grey-black in section and contains many small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394507) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394507)
